articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The House Majority Whip questions the regulatory agency's recent actions.

articles.description: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.
articles.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity

articles.description: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
articles.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'

articles.description: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.
articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX Group, which also owns the IEX exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.
articles.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.description: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.
articles.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast

articles.description: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."
articles.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace

articles.description: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."
articles.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini

articles.description: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.
articles.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Bitcoin ATM maker General Bytes has become the latest victim of a cyber attack, with the company announcing a loss of $1.5 million in digital assets.
 
The breach occurred Friday, and has dealt a heavy blow to one of the biggest producers of Bitcoin ATMs in the industry, boasting over 9,000 units to its name.
 
 
 
On March 17-18th, 2023, GENERAL BYTES experienced a security incident.
 
We released a statement urging customers to take immediate action to protect their personal information.
 
We urge all our customers to take immediate action to protect their funds and https://t.co/fajc61lcwR… https://t.co/g5FGqvqZQ7
 
— GENERAL BYTES (@generalbytes) March 18, 2023
 

 
Hot Wallets, Exchanges Breached
 
General Bytes has reported that the recent cyber attack resulted in the unauthorized acc…
articles.title: Major Bitcoin ATM Maker Hacked, Over $1.5 Million In BTC Stolen

articles.author: Jake Simmons
articles.description:
Burning Shiba Inu tokens is one of the SHIB Army’s main concerns in order to increase the price of the meme coin. Remarkably, the SHIB burn rate has surged since early March, with one player standing out: the Koyo Token project.
 
The Koyo Token is a decentralized finance project (DeFi) based on the Ethereum blockchain that aims to provide a platform where users can access various financial services, including lending, borrowing, and staking, in a decentralized manner.
 
The platform’s native cryptocurrency is the Koyo token. This serves as a payment method for accessing the various financial services on the platform. According to CoinMarketCap, the token is ranked #3180 and has a market cap of just $8.4 million.
 
Nevertheless, the project has burned a whopping 4.631 billion Shiba Inu tok…
articles.title: Billions Of Shiba Inu (SHIB) Tokens Will Be Burned By This Project

articles.author: BtcCasey
articles.description:
Grayscale Bitcoin Trust investors unsatisfied with the status quo will meet at Bitcoin 2023 in an effort to address issues they see in the Trust.
 
         
         
         
         
    
Disclaimer: BTC Inc. is the parent company of Bitcoin Magazine and the Bitcoin Conference.
The RedeemGBTC.com campaign, a grassroots movement to address the dissatisfaction many Grayscale shareholders have expressed in the management of the Grayscale Bitcoin Trust, has announced a pivotal shareholder meeting at Bitcoin 2023. 
The Trust, now trading at an approximate 40% discount, has created a “situation [that] calls for immediate action and has led to the organization of the GBTC Shareholders Meetup by RedeemGBTC.com.” The goal of the meetup in Miami is to provide these concerned investors with a venue to convene for discussion in regards to the future of the Trust. 
RedeemGBTC.com also announced that it is accepting proposals from companies interested in becoming the next sponsor for the Trust. “Proposals will be reviewed by the organizers, and selected companies will have the opportunity to present their ideas at the GBTC Shareholders Meetup,” the announcement says. “Shareholders will have the chance to engage with these companies, evaluate their propositions, and provide feedback.”
According to the announcement, more than 30% of the GBTC shareholders are anticipated to be in attendance, making it a formidable gathering of collective investors. 
Additional information on the GBTC Shareholders Meetup, registration for the meetup and a submission portal for sponsorship proposals are available on the Bitcoin 2023 Industry Day page.
articles.title: RedeemGBTC Campaign To Host Shareholders Meetup At Miami Bitcoin Conference

articles.author: Lubomir Tassev
articles.description:
Blockchain technology can help solve current issues with settlements, according to the deputy chief executive of Sberbank. Russia’s largest bank is working with other financial institutions to develop blockchain-based payment applications, the banker revealed.
 
Sberbank Sees Solution to Russia’s Troubles With Settlements in Blockchain
 
With major Russian banks disconnected from the main global interbank payment system, SWIFT, due to Moscow’s war on Ukraine, blockchain will help to solve the problem with payments, Sberbank’s First Deputy CEO Alexander Vedyakhin is convinced.
 
“It is blockchain technology that will make it possible to solve this issue because this is a distributed ledger, there is no one point of decision making, no center, no knife switch that can be shut off,” Vedyakhin…
articles.title: Blockchain to Become More Relevant in Payments This Year, Sberbank Exec Says

articles.description:
PRESS RELEASE. WATERPORT PLACE, GIB., March 20th, 2023 – Digital Asset Management Limited and the Damex group (“Damex” or “Damex.io”)), a Distributed Ledger Technology provider based in Gibraltar, recently announced its utility token IEO, the Damex Token ($DAMEX), which can be used within the Damex App along with other non-fungible tokens (NFTs), to earn rewards for adopting a healthier and more active lifestyle.
 
Damex announced its token IEO for 19th April. Its utility went live and was tested during the Q1 of 2023, with future developments for both the Damex Token and the Damex App slated throughout the year. The total supply is 370 million Damex Tokens.
 
The goal of these new offerings by Damex is to encourage users to become healthier individuals while, at the same time, educating t…
articles.title: Damex Releases in-App Utility Token Damex Token, Enables Users to Earn Rewards for Staking Tokens

articles.title: EU’s MiCA Crypto Law Debate Scheduled for April 18

articles.title: Market Maker DWF Labs Invests $20M in DeFi Liquidity Protocol Synthetix

articles.author: Jake Simmons
articles.description:
Due to the insolvency of several U.S. banks and the ongoing liquidity problems of supposedly over 186 US banks, as well as the acquisition of Credit Suisse by UBS Bank, Bitcoin and crypto are more bullish than ever. On Sunday, the Bitcoin price peaked at over $28,400.
 
About 15 years after the bankruptcy of major US bank Lehman Brothers and the Great Financial Crisis, Satoshi Nakamoto’s vision is increasingly coming true. As the US banking system faces another major crisis and bailouts, investors are currently fleeing into Bitcoin.
 
 
This is literally what was inscribed in the genesis #Bitcoin block.
 
It was designed for this environment. pic.twitter.com/xiTV4Cx0jC
 
— _Checkɱate  (@_Checkmatey_) March 17, 2023
 

 
Nevertheless, investors in the Bitcoin and crypto space should continu…
articles.title: Big Week Ahead For Bitcoin And Crypto: This Will Be Key

articles.description: Bitcoin is in the spotlight as cracks emerge in the traditional banking system, one observer said, explaining the negative spread between ether and bitcoin implied volatility metrics.
articles.title: Crypto Market Witnesses Odd Relationship Between Bitcoin, Ether Volatility Metrics

articles.title: FTX’s Bahamas Arm a ‘Nullity’ That Should Be Stripped of Assets: Court Filings

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
The FDIC has announced in a statement Sunday that Signature Bank, now known as Signature Bridge Bank, will transfer its non-crypto deposits to Flagstar Bank, a subsidiary of New York Community Bancorp, effective Monday.
 
The move, according to a news release, comes as part of a purchase and assumption agreement between the two financial institutions, allowing for a seamless transition of accounts.
 
A notable point to highlight is that Flagstar Bank’s acquisition deal did not cover the roughly $4 billion worth of cryptocurrency deposits held by Signature Bank. Instead, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation has assured that customers who hold a digital banking account will have their deposits transferred directly to them. 
 
Meanwhile, depositors of Signature Bridge Bank, with the exce…
articles.title: FDIC Sells Signature Bank’s Deposits To Flagstar, Excludes $4 Billion In Crypto

articles.author: Damian Chmiel
articles.description:
Christian Hui, the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury in Hong Kong, was one of the speakers at the Aspen Digital Web 3 Investment Summit on 20 March 2023. During his speech, which focused on building the position of China's Special Administrative Region as a leader in the Web3 revolution, he revealed that since October last year, more than 80 foreign and Mainland China crypto companies had expressed interest in establishing a branch in Hong Kong and obtaining local licenses.

Hong Kong Attracts Cryptocurrency Companies

In October last year, Hong Kong published a statement on the cryptocurrency market regulation, which ind…
articles.title: Hong Kong to Start Regulating Crypto in June 2023, 80 Companies Want to Join

articles.author: Sam Reynolds
articles.description: An uptick in open interest alongside a price rally is said to confirm an uptrend.
articles.title: Open Interest in Bitcoin Futures Hits Yearly High of $12B

articles.author: Arnab Shome
articles.description:
Belgian financial market supervisor, the Financial Services and Markets Authority (FSMA), will impose a new set of rules on the promotion of cryptocurrencies within its jurisdiction, which will come into effect on 17 May 2023.

Belgium Mandates Crypto Risk Warnings

There are three key areas to the new crypto advertising rule: the message must be accurate and not misleading, ads must contain mandatory risk information, and crypto companies need to inform FSMA ahead of any mass campaign.

In the Belgian O…
articles.title: "The Only Guarantee in Crypto Is Risk:" Belgium to Mandate Warnings on Ads

articles.author: Sergio Goschenko
articles.description:
A report issued by Globaldata, a global consulting and data analysis company, predicts that China will become a leading country in metaverse tech during 2023. The firm believes that the development of other technologies like artificial intelligence (AI), virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 6G will allow China to configure itself as a metaverse hub.
China to Lead Metaverse Industry in 2023
While the interest in the metaverse seems to be waning at a worldwide level, China is still pushing to become a leader in the industry. According to a recent report prepared by Globaldata, a consulting firm, China is positioning itself to surpass the West when it comes to metaverse tech, as the country will keep investing in technologies related to this field.
The report states the importanc…
articles.title: Report: China Will Become a Metaverse Tech Leader During 2023
